Package game.arenas

Class Arena

java.lang.Object
game.arenas.Arena
All Implemented Interfaces:
ArenaPlan, PropertyChangeListener, EventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
AerialArena, LandArena, NavalArena
public abstract class Arena extends Object implements PropertyChangeListener, ArenaPlan
The general Arena type abstract class, used to store arena details for specific kinds of arenas.
Version:
3 08 June 2023
Author:
Yovel Nirenberg 318276177, Arbel Zagag 315316794
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • propertyChange

      public void propertyChange(PropertyChangeEvent evt)
      Listens to property changes of a Racer object. Updates the racerData table based on the property change event. If the property change is related to currentSpeed, xLocation, or finished status, the corresponding data in the racerData table is updated. The table is then reordered if a racer has finished the race. Finally, the updated table is reflected in the UI.
      Specified by:
      propertyChange in interface PropertyChangeListener
      Parameters:
      evt - the property change event

    • addRacer

      public abstract void addRacer(Racer newRacer) throws RacerLimitException, RacerTypeException
      Abstract method Adds new racers to the arena types
      Parameters:
      newRacer -
      Throws:
      RacerLimitException - if arena max racer limit is hit
      RacerTypeException - if racer type doesn't match arena type

    • initRace

      public void initRace()
      Initializes the race by setting up the racers and their initial positions. Each racer is assigned a starting and finishing point based on the race length and the Y gap between racers. The method also adds a property change listener to each racer to monitor their progress.

    • addRacerData

      public void addRacerData(Racer r)
      Adds racer data to the race information. The racer's name, current speed, max speed, current X location, and finished status are added to the data. The method is typically called when a new racer is added to the race.
      Parameters:
      r - the racer to add data for

    • hasActiveRacers

      public boolean hasActiveRacers()
      Checks if Arena has any active players left
      Returns:
      True if there are players left, if no players are left returns False

    • playTurn

      public void playTurn()
      Play turn for each player in the Arena until all players are finished
